name: NSWindow.Depth
desc: A type that represents the depth, or amount of memory, for a single pixel in a window or screen.

items.name: case onehundredtwentyeightBitRGB
items.desc: One hundred and twenty eight bit RGB depth limit.

items.name: case sixtyfourBitRGB
items.desc: Sixty four bit RGB depth limit.

items.name: case twentyfourBitRGB
items.desc: Twenty four bit RGB depth limit.

items.name: static var availableDepths: [NSWindow.Depth]
items.desc: An array that contains all available windows depths.

items.name: static func bestDepth(colorSpaceName: NSColorSpaceName, bitsPerSample: Int, bitsPerPixel: Int, isPlanar: Bool) -> (NSWindow.Depth, isExactMatch: Bool)
items.desc: Determines the best window depth that most closely matches the given properties.

items.name: var bitsPerPixel: Int
items.desc: Returns the bits per pixel for the specified window depth.

items.name: var bitsPerSample: Int
items.desc: Returns the bits per sample for the specified window depth.

items.name: var colorSpaceName: NSColorSpaceName?
items.desc: Returns the name of the color space corresponding to the passed window depth.

items.name: var isPlanar: Bool
items.desc: Returns whether the specified window depth is planar.
